For starters, I had no idea that any of those [Cartel Aristocrat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cartel Aristocrat)s were actually vampires, which does a lot to explain their abilities.

posts.post_content: I get the reference to the boros reckoner-charm combo and how this effectively replaces 2 cards with 1, but lets be serious here. if youre running junk (white green black) with boros reckoner and want to go infinite with lifegain, more power to you. I totally underestimated this card when i first caught a glimpse. "cool, a junk split card for a rare..." but really its like a second boros charm in naya with an added effect. Boros charm is still the man when it comes to pulling the okie-doke on your opponents supreme verdict, but this card in standard is nice sideboard material against multiple strategies, without "willing" being part of the equation. But hey, if you have a sylvan caryatid and 5 naya mana, LET IT RIP DOO.
posts.html:

Posted By: Continue (12/5/2013 10:11:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Is anyone else annoyed by the color combinations of the five fuse cards? I'm glad that enemy tri-color decks are getting more cards, but they created a bit of an imbalance.   
Each wedge had:  
1. A card from apocalypse   
2. A legendary dragon  
3. Two mythic legendaries  
  
The only outlying cards before Dragon's Maze were [Doran, the Siege Tower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doran, the Siege Tower) and [Maelstrom Wanderer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maelstrom Wanderer). this left a slight imbalance. with the release of this card however, W/B/G now has two more than W/B/R and U/B/G, and one more than B/R/G and W/B/R. Hopefully Wizards will print more enemy wedge cards with further products and even out the color imbalance.  
  
Edit: After further research, I found that W/B/G is also the only enemy tri-color wedge to have a [land](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=153467). Maybe Wizards just favors W/B/G?
posts.html:
Is anyone else annoyed by the color combinations of the five fuse cards? I'm glad that enemy tri-color decks are getting more cards, but they created a bit of an imbalance.
Each wedge had:
1. A card from apocalypse
2. A legendary dragon
3. Two mythic legendaries

The only outlying cards before Dragon's Maze were Doran, the Siege Tower and Maelstrom Wanderer. this left a slight imbalance. with the release of this card however, W/B/G now has two more than W/B/R and U/B/G, and one more than B/R/G and W/B/R. Hopefully Wizards will print more enemy wedge cards with further products and even out the color imbalance.

Edit: After further research, I found that W/B/G is also the only enemy tri-color wedge to have a land. Maybe Wizards just favors W/B/G?
